  "description": "Hoop Telecoms Limited was established in 2017 as a full Telecommunications Service provider. Since its formation, Hoop Telecoms has been growing rapidly and is emerging as a leading provider of telecommunication and business solutions. Our goal is to be the telecom company of choice for voice, video, and data for consumers in Nigeria, West Africa, Africa, and globally. Simply put; our vision is global.

HOOPTEL is led by a strong management team with knowledge and extensive experience in the telecom industry, and other professionals with strong administrative skills and experience. We are primarily focused on delivering solutions to customers in Enterprise networks connectivity, Broadband internet services, Voice communication solutions, Video and secured data solutions, Data Centre and co-location services, managed cloud services, and other related telecommunication systems. We are a company driven to provide our customers with solutions that are customized to fit their current needs, yet flexible enough to accommodate their growth plans, at the most competitive pricing on all service offerings, thus optimizing IT spend and future proofing of our solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive

Job Locations:&nbsp;Ilupeju and Gbagada - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Sales Executive is responsible for driving revenue growth by identifying, developing, and closing sales opportunities within the telecoms sector.
	The role involves building strong client relationships, promoting telecoms products and services, and ensuring customer satisfaction to achieve business targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities within the telecoms industry (corporate, SME, and retail clients).
	Promote and sell telecoms products and services (e.g., internet connectivity, data solutions, voice services, enterprise solutions, managed services, etc.).
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential customers.
	Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations.
	Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets and KPIs.
	Negotiate and close deals, ensuring profitable margins and client satisfaction.
	Collaborate with the Service Management, Technology, and Finance teams to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Conduct market research to identify trends, competitors, and customer needs.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, pipeline, and customer interactions using CRM tools.
	Provide feedback to management on customer requirements and potential product improvements.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Telecommunications, or related field.
	2&ndash;5 years of proven sales experience, preferably in telecoms, IT, or related industries.
	Strong understanding of telecoms products and services (internet, data, fiber, voice, enterprise solutions, etc.).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and achieve set targets.
	Strong customer service orientation and relationship management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and CRM software.


Key Competencies:


	Results-driven and target-oriented.
	Strong business acumen.
	Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Good problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Networking and relationship-building ability.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@hooptelecoms.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

We are primarily focused on delivering solutions to customers in Enterprise networks connectivity, Broadband internet services, Voice communication solutions, Video and secured data solutions, Data Centre and co-location services, managed cloud services, and other related telecommunication systems. We are a company driven to provide our customers with solutions that are customized to fit their current needs, yet flexible enough to accommodate their growth plans, at the most competitive pricing on all service offerings, thus optimizing IT spend and future proofing of our solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive

Job Locations: Ilupeju and Gbagada - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Sales Executive is responsible for driving revenue growth by identifying, developing, and closing sales opportunities within the telecoms sector.
	The role involves building strong client relationships, promoting telecoms products and services, and ensuring customer satisfaction to achieve business targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities within the telecoms industry (corporate, SME, and retail clients).
	Promote and sell telecoms products and services (e.g., internet connectivity, data solutions, voice services, enterprise solutions, managed services, etc.).
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential customers.
	Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations.
	Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets and KPIs.
	Negotiate and close deals, ensuring profitable margins and client satisfaction.
	Collaborate with the Service Management, Technology, and Finance teams to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Conduct market research to identify trends, competitors, and customer needs.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, pipeline, and customer interactions using CRM tools.
	Provide feedback to management on customer requirements and potential product improvements.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Telecommunications, or related field.
	2–5 years of proven sales experience, preferably in telecoms, IT, or related industries.
	Strong understanding of telecoms products and services (internet, data, fiber, voice, enterprise solutions, etc.).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and achieve set targets.
	Strong customer service orientation and relationship management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and CRM software.


Key Competencies:


	Results-driven and target-oriented.
	Strong business acumen.
	Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Good problem-solving and analytical skills.

Real Estate Sales Executive Job at Inab Realty Limited




        
    

        
        Inab Realty Limited is a Lagos-based real estate agency with a clear mission: to simplify property transactions and create long-term value for homeowners, investors, and developers alike. We specialize in helping clients buy, sell, rent, and develop properties across Nigeria—with a strong focus on service, transparency, and results. Whether it’s finding a dream home or unlocking a high-yield investment, we bring deep market knowledge and a client-first mindset to every transaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Real Estate Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Sales Executives are responsible for driving property sales by engaging prospects, closing deals, and expanding the company’s listings.
	They will report directly to the Sales Manager and actively contribute to property sourcing, client acquisition, and marketing efforts.nt.


Responsibilities: 


	Scout for new properties (lands, houses, and commercial spaces) suitable for listing. 
	Generate and follow up on leads through fieldwork, social media, networking, and referrals. 
	Conduct property inspections, presentations, and client consultations. 
	Collaborate with the Sales Manager and marketing team to develop creative content ideas and property marketing strategies. 
	Participate in creating promotional materials (e.g., reels, photos, captions, scripts). 
	Represent the company at open houses, property tours, and exhibitions. 
	Maintain an organised client database and provide regular sales reports.  


Requirements


	OND/HND/B.Sc. in any relevant field. 
	2 years of previous experience in real estate or direct sales is an advantage. 
	Must be self-driven, confident, and result-oriented. 
	Creative thinking and the ability to contribute marketing content ideas. 
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. 
	Ability to work collaboratively within a team and meet set targets.


Remuneration


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Opportunities for professional growth in a dynamic company 


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@inabgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Job Summary


	The Investment Officer is responsible for driving the growth of the bank&rsquo;s deposit portfolio by sourcing new customers, marketing deposit products, and maintaining strong client relationships.
	The role is target-driven and focused on mobilizing deposits from individuals, SMEs, and corporate organizations in line with the bank&rsquo;s strategic objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Aggressively mobilize deposits (savings, current, fixed/investment deposits) to meet assigned targets.
	Market the bank&rsquo;s investment and liability products to new and existing customers.
	Identify, prospect, and develop new business opportunities across retail, SME, and corporate segments.
	Prepare and submit marketing reports on deposit mobilization activities.
	Monitor competitors&rsquo; deposit rates and marketing strategies, and provide feedback to management.
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships to enhance loyalty and retention.
	Provide advisory to customers on available deposit and investment products to suit their financial needs.
	Achieve daily, weekly, and monthly deposit targets as assigned by management.
	Cross-sell other bank products and services to deposit customers.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	HND / B.Sc. in Marketing, Business Administration, Banking &amp; Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of experience in deposit mobilization, marketing, or sales in commercial, microfinance bank or fintech
	Proven ability to meet and exceed set deposit targets.

	Strong marketing, negotiation, and networking skills.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Goal-driven, proactive, and result-oriented.
	Ability to work under pressure with minimal supervision.
	High level of integrity and professionalism.


Method of Application
